com.faltro.houdoku.controller

Class LibraryController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.faltro.houdoku.controller.Controller
      • com.faltro.houdoku.controller.LibraryController

  • public class LibraryController
extends Controller
    The controller for the library page, the default view for the client.

    The FXML file for this view is at resources/fxml/library.fxml

    See Also:
    Controller

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initialize the components of the controller's view.

        This method binds the size of components as appropriate using this class' static variables. It creates and sets the cell factory and cell value factory for the columns in the series table. It also creates the items in the category tree using the root category from the library.

        Overrides:
        initialize in class Controller
        See Also:
        Controller.initialize()

      • onMadeActive

        Description copied from class: Controller

        onMadeInactive in class Controller
        See Also:
        Controller.onMadeInactive()

      • updateContent

        public void updateContent()
        Populates the tableView and treeView with series from the library.

        This function should be run whenever there is a possibility that a series has been added or removed from the library. It does not need to be run whenever the properties of a series changes, since the cell factories will handle that properly with just tableView.refresh().

      • setCombinedPredicate

        private void setCombinedPredicate(javafx.collections.transformation.FilteredList<Series> filteredData)
        Set the predicate of the series table's FilteredList.

        This method filters the given list based on the contents of the filterTextField and on the selected category.

        This method needs to be called whenever actions which could change the predicate are performed - i.e., clicking a category.

        Parameters:
        filteredData - the FilteredList of series to set the predicate of

      • newCellClickHandler

        private javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> newCellClickHandler(javafx.scene.control.ContextMenu contextMenu)
        Creates a MouseEvent handler for a cell in the series table.

        This handler handles double clicking to go to a series' page, as well as handling the actions of the given context menu if a series is right clicked.

        Parameters:
        contextMenu - the context menu shown when right clicking
        Returns:
        a complete MouseEvent EventHandler for a cell in the series table

      • newCategoryClickHandler

        private javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> newCategoryClickHandler(javafx.scene.control.ContextMenu contextMenu)
        Creates a MouseEvent handler for a category in the categories tree.

        The handler does not trigger a filter of the series table's data when a category is clicked. That is done by adding a listener to the tree's selection property. Instead, this handler primarily handles the actions of the given context menu when a category is right clicked.

        Parameters:
        contextMenu - the context menu shown when right clicking
        Returns:
        a complete MouseEvent EventHandler for a category in the tree

      • getTreeItemByCategory

        private javafx.scene.control.TreeItem<Category> getTreeItemByCategory(Category category)
        Retrieves the TreeItem of the tree corresponding to the given category.

        If the category is not in the tree, this method will return null.

        Parameters:
        category - the category to search for in the tree
        Returns:
        the TreeItem corresponding to the given category, or null

      • promptAddCategory

        private void promptAddCategory(Category category)
        Prompts the user to add a category as a child of the given category.
        Parameters:
        category - the category which will be the parent of the new category, if one is successfully created

      • promptEditCategory

        private void promptEditCategory(Category category)
        Prompts the user to edit the given category.

        The dialog prompt allows the user to alter both the color and text of the category. The dialog is identical to that from promptAddCategory, but we will keep them separate in case we want them to have somewhat different functionality in the future.

        Parameters:
        category - the category to edit

      • promptEditCategories

        private void promptEditCategories(Series series)
        Prompts the user to edit the categories of the given series.
        Parameters:
        series - the series to edit

      • promptRemoveSeries

        private void promptRemoveSeries(Series series)
        Prompts the user to remove the given series.
        Parameters:
        series - the series to be removed

      • goToSeries

        void goToSeries(Series series)
        Changes to the series page for the given series.
        Parameters:
        series - the series to be viewed

      • setCompact

        private void setCompact(boolean compact)
        Set whether the compact view is enabled.

        Enabling the compact view removes the cover column of the series table, making the height of each row much smaller.

      • promptRemoveSelectedSeries

        public void promptRemoveSelectedSeries()
        Prompts the user to remove the selected series.

        If no series is selected, this function does nothing.

      • updateLayout

        private void updateLayout()
        Update the visible layout based on the selected option.

      • goToSearchSeries

        public void goToSearchSeries()
        Change to the search series page.

      • goToSelectedSeries

        private void goToSelectedSeries()
        Changes to the series page with the selected series.

        If no series is selected, this function does nothing.

      • toggleActionBar

        private void toggleActionBar()
        Toggles whether the action bar is visible.

        The action bar is the bar above the tree and table with buttons for common actions, i.e. "Add Series", "Remove Series".

      • getLibrary

        public Library getLibrary()
